page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY HOLBECHE HOUSE
page.content: Kingswinford boasts a novel idea in executive clubs for business men.The business man can now relax in idyllic surroundings with many leisure activities and be steeped in history. This jewel in our historic crown is {Holbeche House}which was built in 1534 although part of it may date to 1022. It sheltered the escaping{Gunpowder {Plotters,}Lyttleton and Winter, both local men, pursued by the Sheriff of Worcester.A terrible battle ensued and gunpowder left to dry by the fire in the hall exploded. Gideon Grove, a groom, fled from the blaze but was shot in error and is thought to be the ghost known locally as The Headless Horseman. The house is haunted by the Grey Lady.{Charles II}hid in the house which has many priest's holes. The grounds have an old mill and well. It is now open to the public for meals.
